title: The Binomial Theorem
description: (x + y)^n = Î£ C(n,k) x^k y^(n-k). One of the most fundamental results in algebra and combinatorics.

meta.author: Al-Karaji, Newton (formalized in Lean 4 with Mathlib)

overview.historicalContext: Known since antiquity. Al-Karaji (~1000) described Pascal's triangle. Newton (1665) extended to fractional exponents.
overview.proofStrategy: Each term arises from choosing k factors of x from n factors in the expansion.

conclusion.summary: The binomial theorem is verified for commutative semirings.
